transcript: Nicole Obarzanek - "Into Another World" Nicole Obarzanek Nicole Obarzanek "Toxic" music video Nicole Obarzanek Nicole Obarzanek, "Toxic" - cover art Nicole Obarzanek Redefines Dance - Pop Genres With Two Sensational New Music Video Releases - “Into Another World” and “Toxic” Nicole's ability to convey raw emotion while commanding the stage is extraordinary” — Sahaj Ticotin, Los Angeles-based music producer LOS ANGELES, CA, UNITED STATES, July 8, 2025 /EINPresswire.com/ -- Nicole Obarzanek, the 14-year-old multi-talented prodigy from Dubai, is setting the global music scene ablaze with the release of two electrifying music videos for her singles “Into Another World” and “Toxic.” Born in Poland in 2010, and now a rising star in the UAE, Nicole's dynamic performances as a singer, dancer, actor, and model are showcased in these visually stunning videos, now streaming across YouTube, Apple Music, Spotify, and Anghami. “Into Another World,” produced by acclaimed Los Angeles-based producer Sahaj Ticotin, blends contemporary dance rhythms with orchestral elements, reflecting Nicole's rich musical heritage. The video, filmed across Dubai and Los Angeles at SoundStruck Studios and FIVE Hotel Music Studio, incorporates cutting-edge AI technology and futuristic visuals, elevating her artistry to new heights. “Nicole's ability to convey raw emotion while commanding the stage is extraordinary,” says Sahaj Ticotin. “These videos carve out her mark as a visionary artist.” “Toxic,” a powerful dance pop anthem released via LA Music Records, delivers a raw, emotional narrative about overcoming toxic relationships, with captivating choreography and intense vocals that resonate deeply with audiences of all ages. “Nicole is a rare talent who brings passion and precision to every performance,” says Alina Liwo, founder of ALITI Productions & Talent Agency, who has been instrumental in guiding Nicole's stage presence, singing, modeling, and acting. “Her dedication to her craft at such a young age is truly inspiring, and these new releases are a testament to her boundless potential. Despite her demanding schedule as a full-time student, Nicole commits over 15 hours weekly to honing her skills under the mentorship of Dubai's finest industry coaches. She trains in classical music and violin with Mariana Lutsiv and collaborates with internationally acclaimed music producer Robert M. to craft her signature sound. Nicole's dedication and drive are evident in every frame as well as her performances at the WATERBOMB 2024 Dubai Festival, where she debuted four original songs before 30,000 fans, and at elite venues like the Palazzo Versace Dubai, and Burj Khalifa's Armani Hotel, which have solidified her reputation. Nicole's star power extends beyond music, with appearances in renowned publications such as GLAMOUR, Wizaz, Polki.pl, and GOLDEN WINGS Luxury Magazine. Her poise, talent, and relentless work ethic have made her a sought-after figure in both the entertainment and fashion industries. Nicole's rise is backed by LA Music Records, and a team of industry veterans, including producer Robert M. and Grammy-winner RedOne. With her debut album slated for release in Q4 2025, featuring collaborations with both American and Emirati artists, these music videos signal Nicole's unstoppable ascent within the industry. Fans and media are invited to follow Nicole's journey as she continues to redefine what it means to be a young performer in today's global spotlight. Stay up on the latest music and news on Instagram (@nicole. obarzanek) and TikTok (@nicoleobarzanek. official). cleaned_transcript: Nicole Obarzanek - "Into Another World" Nicole Obarzanek Nicole Obarzanek "Toxic" music video Nicole Obarzanek Nicole Obarzanek, "Toxic" - cover art Nicole Obarzanek Redefines Dance - Pop Genres With Two Sensational New Music Video Releases - “Into Another World” and “Toxic” Nicole's ability to convey raw emotion while commanding the stage is extraordinary” — Sahaj Ticotin, Los Angeles-based music producer LOS ANGELES, CA, UNITED STATES, July 8, 2025 /EINPresswire.com/ -- Nicole Obarzanek, the 14-year-old multi-talented prodigy from Dubai, is setting the global music scene ablaze with the release of two electrifying music videos for her singles “Into Another World” and “Toxic.” Born in Poland in 2010, and now a rising star in the UAE, Nicole's dynamic performances as a singer, dancer, actor, and model are showcased in these visually stunning videos, now streaming across YouTube, Apple Music, Spotify, and Anghami. “Into Another World,” produced by acclaimed Los Angeles-based producer Sahaj Ticotin, blends contemporary dance rhythms with orchestral elements, reflecting Nicole's rich musical heritage. The video, filmed across Dubai and Los Angeles at SoundStruck Studios and FIVE Hotel Music Studio, incorporates cutting-edge AI technology and futuristic visuals, elevating her artistry to new heights. “Nicole's ability to convey raw emotion while commanding the stage is extraordinary,” says Sahaj Ticotin. “These videos carve out her mark as a visionary artist.” “Toxic,” a powerful dance pop anthem released via LA Music Records, delivers a raw, emotional narrative about overcoming toxic relationships, with captivating choreography and intense vocals that resonate deeply with audiences of all ages. “Nicole is a rare talent who brings passion and precision to every performance,” says Alina Liwo, founder of ALITI Productions & Talent Agency, who has been instrumental in guiding Nicole's stage presence, singing, modeling, and acting. “Her dedication to her craft at such a young age is truly inspiring, and these new releases are a testament to her boundless potential. Despite her demanding schedule as a full-time student, Nicole commits over 15 hours weekly to honing her skills under the mentorship of Dubai's finest industry coaches. She trains in classical music and violin with Mariana Lutsiv and collaborates with internationally acclaimed music producer Robert M. to craft her signature sound. Nicole's dedication and drive are evident in every frame as well as her performances at the WATERBOMB 2024 Dubai Festival, where she debuted four original songs before 30,000 fans, and at elite venues like the Palazzo Versace Dubai, and Burj Khalifa's Armani Hotel, which have solidified her reputation. Nicole's star power extends beyond music, with appearances in renowned publications such as GLAMOUR, Wizaz, Polki.pl, and GOLDEN WINGS Luxury Magazine. Her poise, talent, and relentless work ethic have made her a sought-after figure in both the entertainment and fashion industries. Nicole's rise is backed by LA Music Records, and a team of industry veterans, including producer Robert M. and Grammy-winner RedOne. With her debut album slated for release in Q4 2025, featuring collaborations with both American and Emirati artists, these music videos signal Nicole's unstoppable ascent within the industry. Fans and media are invited to follow Nicole's journey as she continues to redefine what it means to be a young performer in today's global spotlight. Stay up on the latest music and news on Instagram (. obarzanek) and TikTok (. official). "Her dedication to her craft at such a young age is truly inspiring, and these new releases are a testament to her boundless potential. Despite her demanding schedule as a full-time student, Nicole commits over 15 hours weekly to honing her skills under the mentorship of Dubai's finest industry coaches. She trains in classical music and violin with Mariana Lutsiv and collaborates with internationally acclaimed music producer Robert M. to craft her signature sound. Nicole's dedication and drive are evident in every frame as well as her performances at the WATERBOMB 2024 Dubai Festival, where she debuted four original songs before 30,000 fans, and at elite venues like the Palazzo Versace Dubai, and Burj Khalifa's Armani Hotel, which have solidified her reputation. Nicole's star power extends beyond music, with appearances in renowned publications such as GLAMOUR, Wizaz, Polki, and GOLDEN WINGS Luxury Magazine. Her poise, talent, and relentless work ethic have made her a sought-after figure in both the entertainment and fashion industries. Nicole's rise is backed by LA Music Records, and a team of industry veterans, including producer Robert M. and Grammy-winner RedOne. With her debut album slated for release in Q4 2025, featuring collaborations with both American and Emirati artists, these music videos signal Nicole's unstoppable ascent within the industry. Fans and media are invited to follow Nicole's journey as she continues to redefine what it means to be a young performer in today's global spotlight. transcript: Nicole Obarzanek Redefines Dance - Pop Genres With Two Sensational New Music Video Releases - “Into Another World” and “Toxic” Nicole Obarzanek Redefines Dance - Pop Genres With Two Sensational New Music Video Releases - “Into Another World” and “Toxic” Nicole's ability to convey raw emotion while commanding the stage is extraordinary”— Sahaj Ticotin, Los Angeles-based music producer LOS ANGELES, CA, UNITED STATES, July 8, 2025 /EINPresswire.com/ -- Nicole Obarzanek, the 14-year-old multi-talented prodigy from Dubai, is setting the global music scene ablaze with the release of two electrifying music videos for her singles “Into Another World” and “Toxic.” Born in Poland in 2010, and now a rising star in the UAE, Nicole's dynamic performances as a singer, dancer, actor, and model are showcased in these visually stunning videos, now streaming across YouTube, Apple Music, Spotify, and Anghami. “Into Another World,” produced by acclaimed Los Angeles-based producer Sahaj Ticotin, blends contemporary dance rhythms with orchestral elements, reflecting Nicole's rich musical heritage. The video, filmed across Dubai and Los Angeles at SoundStruck Studios and FIVE Hotel Music Studio, incorporates cutting-edge AI technology and futuristic visuals, elevating her artistry to new heights. “Nicole's ability to convey raw emotion while commanding the stage is extraordinary,” says Sahaj Ticotin. “These videos carve out her mark as a visionary artist.” “Toxic,” a powerful dance pop anthem released via LA Music Records, delivers a raw, emotional narrative about overcoming toxic relationships, with captivating choreography and intense vocals that resonate deeply with audiences of all ages. “Nicole is a rare talent who brings passion and precision to every performance,” says Alina Liwo, founder of ALITI Productions & Talent Agency, who has been instrumental in guiding Nicole's stage presence, singing, modeling, and acting. “Her dedication to her craft at such a young age is truly inspiring, and these new releases are a testament to her boundless potential. Despite her demanding schedule as a full-time student, Nicole commits over 15 hours weekly to honing her skills under the mentorship of Dubai's finest industry coaches. She trains in classical music and violin with Mariana Lutsiv and collaborates with internationally acclaimed music producer Robert M. to craft her signature sound. Nicole's dedication and drive are evident in every frame as well as her performances at the WATERBOMB 2024 Dubai Festival, where she debuted four original songs before 30,000 fans, and at elite venues like the Palazzo Versace Dubai, and Burj Khalifa's Armani Hotel, which have solidified her reputation. Nicole's star power extends beyond music, with appearances in renowned publications such as GLAMOUR, Wizaz, Polki.pl, and GOLDEN WINGS Luxury Magazine. Her poise, talent, and relentless work ethic have made her a sought-after figure in both the entertainment and fashion industries. Nicole's rise is backed by LA Music Records, and a team of industry veterans, including producer Robert M. and Grammy-winner RedOne. With her debut album slated for release in Q4 2025, featuring collaborations with both American and Emirati artists, these music videos signal Nicole's unstoppable ascent within the industry. Fans and media are invited to follow Nicole's journey as she continues to redefine what it means to be a young performer in today's global spotlight. Stay up on the latest music and news on Instagram (@nicole. obarzanek) and TikTok (@nicoleobarzanek. official). Nicole Obarzanek - Into Another World (Official Music Video)

transcript: Housed in the former residence of Santo Versace, The Wilde brings a new kind of cultural hospitality to Milan. Designed by Fabrizio Casiraghi, the private club balances Milanese discretion with global sophistication—layering walnut, velvet, lacquer, and bold contemporary art. Each room tells its own story, from sunlit rooftop AVA to the pink-walled bar below. A collector's spirit runs through it all: timeless interiors in dialogue with modern expression. transcript: SPR_COMBO[it]È l'8 luglio e in molti vedono avvicinarsi le ferie. Diciamoci la verità, ci va poco di parlare della Paris Fashion Week (autunno/inverno, questo sconosciuto) e dei front row ai quali comunque non partecipiamo. La domanda fondamentale non è, stavolta, quella sulla vita l'universo e tutto quanto ma è solo "cosa mettiamo in valigia?". Per gli ultimi giorni prima delle vacanze c'è voglia di leggerezza, e chi dice leggerezza dice "guarderemo i look delle vip in location esotiche e capiremo se c'è qualche spunto da copiare". Che è proprio quello che faremo in questa ultima newsletter prima dell'estate vera e propria (sì, va in ferie anche la sottoscritta). Il bikini a fantasia (come Dua Lipa) Si aggira per i vicoli di Napoli con il futuro marito, si tuffa nelle acque cristalline delle Baleari insieme alle sue amiche e lo fa rigorosamente in costume a triangolo a fantasia. Il suo preferito - almeno a giudicare da Instagram - è animalier, ma sfoggia volentieri anche un modello a pois (una delle fantasie dell'estate) con inserti di pizzo. Quello per la vacanza spagnola è invece tempestato di cristalli. Il che la dice lunga sui modelli dell'estate: divertenti e dalle linee semplici. Il costume intero? Non pervenuto. Olivia Rodrigo e l'abitino gingham Non è che staremo sempre in spiaggia: certo, a questo punto potremmo non farcela per Wimbledon, ma un abitino bon ton in valigia può sempre servirci per un aperitivo o simili. Sceglietelo come il suo: a quadretti (in gergo gingham), altra fantasia estiva che a sorpresa ha invaso le boutique e tutti i guardaroba delle star, vedere anche alla voce Bella Hadid e Daisy Edgar Jones (il suo, bianco e nero, è già sold out), che lo scelgono in versione prendisole. Il plus? Vi potete sbizzarrire sul colore.  Alexa Chung e la bandana Un occhio (anche alla comodità): avete presente quando, in spiaggia o durante un giro in barca, i capelli svolazzano e sembrate appena uscite dalla seduta di un parrucchiere pazzo? Fortunatamente è tornata di gran moda la bandana, che risolverà tutti i vostri problemi di bad hair day oltre a donarvi quel tocco glam necessario per le foto su Instagram. Come indossarla? Non come Axl Rose ma come vostra nonna. Letteralmente. Fidatevi.  Il parka come gli Oasis La maggior parte del genere umano non è riuscita ad accaparrarsi un biglietto per la reunion dell'estate. Ma qualcuno andrà in montagna: ed è lì che il mood "fratelli Gallagher" potrà davvero sbizzarrirsi: secondo i dati raccolti Shopify il mese di giugno ha registrato un boom di ricerche per tutti i capi di abbigliamento che hanno reso iconici il duo inglese. Leggi parka, le felpe sportive (come le loro ironiche @adidas), bucket hat e giacche trucker.  PILLOLE FASHION L'ultima campagna di Donatella. A marzo è arrivato il temuto annuncio: Donatella ha lasciato la guida creativa di Versace. Il colpo di teatro però era in agguato: per la campagna che segna il suo ultimo atto Donatella ha rispolverato i nomi che hanno reso grande la maison. Kate Moss, Claudia Schiffer, Amber Valletta fotografate da Mert & Marcus per una collezione autunno-inverno dal fascino anni Novanta, che tanto ci piace.  La nuova era di Celine. Per ogni ultimo atto ce ne è un primo: è appena partita ufficialmente l'era di Michael Rider che subentra a Hedi Slimane come direttore creativo di Celine. La collezione, che è stata giudicata positivamente da un po' tutti, non rivoluziona ma rielabora i codici della Maison, come si dice in gergo, mescolandoli con un po' di ironia.  © RIPRODUZIONE RISERVATA

Che è proprio quello che faremo in questa ultima newsletter prima dell'estate vera e propria (sì, va in ferie anche la sottoscritta). Il suo preferito - almeno a giudicare da Instagram - è animalier, ma sfoggia volentieri anche un modello a pois (una delle fantasie dell'estate) con inserti di pizzo. Quello per la vacanza spagnola è invece tempestato di cristalli. Il che la dice lunga sui modelli dell'estate: divertenti e dalle linee semplici. Il costume intero? Non pervenuto. Olivia Rodrigo e l'abitino gingham Non è che staremo sempre in spiaggia: certo, a questo punto potremmo non farcela per Wimbledon, ma un abitino bon ton in valigia può sempre servirci per un aperitivo o simili. Sceglietelo come il suo: a quadretti (in gergo gingham), altra fantasia estiva che a sorpresa ha invaso le boutique e tutti i guardaroba delle star, vedere anche alla voce Bella Hadid e Daisy Edgar Jones (il suo, bianco e nero, è già sold out), che lo scelgono in versione prendisole. Il plus? Vi potete sbizzarrire sul colore. Alexa Chung e la bandana Un occhio (anche alla comodità): avete presente quando, in spiaggia o durante un giro in barca, i capelli svolazzano e sembrate appena uscite dalla seduta di un parrucchiere pazzo? Fortunatamente è tornata di gran moda la bandana, che risolverà tutti i vostri problemi di bad hair day oltre a donarvi quel tocco glam necessario per le foto su Instagram. Come indossarla? Non come Axl Rose ma come vostra nonna. Letteralmente. Fidatevi. Il parka come gli Oasis La maggior parte del genere umano non è riuscita ad accaparrarsi un biglietto per la reunion dell'estate. Ma qualcuno andrà in montagna: ed è lì che il mood "fratelli Gallagher" potrà davvero sbizzarrirsi: secondo i dati raccolti Shopify il mese di giugno ha registrato un boom di ricerche per tutti i capi di abbigliamento che hanno reso iconici il duo inglese. Leggi parka, le felpe sportive (come le loro ironiche ), bucket hat e giacche trucker. PILLOLE FASHION L'ultima campagna di Donatella. A marzo è arrivato il temuto annuncio: Donatella ha lasciato la guida creativa di Versace. Il colpo di teatro però era in agguato: per la campagna che segna il suo ultimo atto Donatella ha rispolverato i nomi che hanno reso grande la maison. Kate Moss, Claudia Schiffer, Amber Valletta fotografate da Mert & Marcus per una collezione autunno-inverno dal fascino anni Novanta, che tanto ci piace. La nuova era di Celine. Per ogni ultimo atto ce ne è un primo: è appena partita ufficialmente l'era di Michael Rider che subentra a Hedi Slimane come direttore creativo di Celine. La collezione, che è stata giudicata positivamente da un po' tutti, non rivoluziona ma rielabora i codici della Maison, come si dice in gergo, mescolandoli con un po' di ironia. RIPRODUZIONE RISERVATA

transcript: NEED TO KNOW Lily James revealed a shocking hair transformation while out in London Days before, the actress had been spotted with her usual honey blonde locks while at Glastonbury 2025 James has previously undergone dramatic hair transformations for photo shoots and acting roles Lily James is going to the dark side. On Saturday, July 5, the actress, 36, stepped out in London with a dramatic new look. In place of her usual honey blonde locks, James sported dark brunette hair that fades into a deep blue-black at the ends. The star was spotted on a casual stroll wearing navy leggings, a brown leather jacket and tan clogs. She carried a white canvas tote bag over her shoulder and wore little to no makeup. On Monday, July 7, James showed off her new look via . In a mirror selfie that appeared to be taken in a gym, the Baby Driver actress posed in a sports bra and leggings, her newly dark hair piled into a messy bun atop her head. Days before debuting her brunette transformation, James was seen with her usual lighter hair color at Glastonbury 2025. In an Instagram shared on June 29, the actress posed with actress Billie Piper at the festival. NASH / BACKGRID Lily James. The recent hair transformation is hardly James' first. In 2022, the actress donned a black wig with blunt bangs and bleached eyebrows in Versace's Fall/Winter 2022 campaign shot by famed duo Mert Alas and Marcus Piggott. Her ensemble in the campaign was also not lacking in drama; she wore a black corset with latex gloves while holding up the fashion house's new Greca Goddess bag. In another photo shared by the luxe Italian label's chief creative officer Donatella Versace on , James is wearing a corseted red dress with red boots and a red bag. The PEOPLE Puzzler crossword is here! How quickly can you solve it? Play now! NASH / BACKGRID Lily James. James famously underwent a dramatic transformation to play Pamela Anderson in the 2022 Hulu miniseries Pam & Tommy. In an interview with Variety, the show's hair department lead Barry Lee Moe revealed that the actress had to go through "anywhere from three to five hours of hair and makeup every morning." Never miss a story — sign up for PEOPLE's free daily newsletter to stay up-to-date on the best of what PEOPLE has to offer, from celebrity news to compelling human interest stories. More in Celebrity James said that the physical transformation was both "freeing and liberating" in a 2022 cover story for Net-a-Porter's Porter. "Slowly, our incredible team found a balance where I resembled Pamela but also felt like I could act through it," the actress shared, noting that she would be in makeup for about four hours starting at 3 a.m., putting on a chest plate, wig and tan. She continued, "I've never done anything where I look very different from myself before. And I'd really like to continue in this vein, because I felt there was something very freeing and liberating in it. There was a bravery that came from that. A courage that came from… disappearing."

transcript: In today's Daily Rundown video, Chris Versace reviews the Portfolio's decision to lock in some gains on American Express  ()  shares on Monday morning, as well as why President Trump's August 1 tariff deadline has injected a fresh wave of uncertainty into the market. Chris also explains why the Portfolio will remain prudent but opportunistic as we head into the June quarter earnings season. And he discusses expectations for Amazon's  ()  2025 Prime Day event, shares which companies we'll be listening to for confirmation, and why quarterly results from ConAgra  ()  could trigger some Bullpen work on our part. Transcript CHRIS VERSACE: Hey, everyone, Chris Versace. It is Monday, July 7. I hope you all had a fun, happy and safe Independence Day holiday. I know I certainly did, but here we are, kicking off the first full week of the September quarter. And as you probably saw, stocks are indeed trading off in response to renewed tariff and trade deal uncertainty. And you hopefully saw that we, in response to that, as well as the shares being overbought, took some profits in American Express shares early this morning. That decision to trim back and lock in some gains on Amex were a combination of the significant move in the shares since their April lows, but also the deep overbought. And by that, we mean relative strength index reading level that the shares had coming into this week. Stepping back a little bit when it comes to tariffs and trade deals, we're going to continue to see how the landscape develops. But our thinking is that if President Trump is coming out swinging, throwing out there this August 1 date when we could see tariff levels go back to their April 2 level, odds are there's some room for the market to be disappointed with what we're likely to hear in terms of announced trade deals in the next few days. Remember, today is the 7. The imposed trade deal deadline is July 9. We are hearing from certain White House officials that there will be deals announced in the next couple of days, but with the market overbought-- and by that, I mean the S&P 500 and the NASDAQ composite-- I'm kind of reading between the tea leaves. Trump throwing out this August 1 deadline seems to me to suggest that there could be some underwhelming interpretation of the deals that are announced. We've talked about this before, but it doesn't seem likely that we're going to get trade deals announced with Canada, with the Eurozone or China this week or anytime soon. So I suspect that's another reason why Trump is throwing out that August 1 date, as I talked about in our opening comments this morning, to try and reclaim the trade deal narrative. Now, again, we're going to continue to follow these developments. But make no mistake, we will remain prudent investors when and where it makes sense. Hence, our move this morning with American Express. But we will also look to remain opportunistic. So if you just think about some of the things that we did in the last few weeks, taking the pronounced strength in the shares of Microsoft, Marvell, NVIDIA, and even today with American Express, we've used them either to build up our cash positions, given what we see ahead or to make an opportunistic move, in some cases, the shares of Alphabet, SuRo Capital. And last week, we started a new position in the shares of TJX. Now, as we get ready for the June quarter earnings season, which is right around the corner, kicking up a gear arguably next week when we start to get big bank earnings, including those from Bank of America and Morgan Stanley, we're going to remain prudent and opportunistic investors. Now, some of the positions that we're interested in building up, TJX, obviously, it's our newest one, but also SuRo capital, ahead of what we expect to see the resumption of dividend payments given its BDC or business development company structure. But before we get to those big bank earnings, we do have a few things we want to talk about, especially Amazon's Prime Day event this week, as well as a number of competing ones. The usual cast of characters Walmart, Target, and a few others. Now remember, Amazon's Prime Day this year has been extended to four days from two, and it's going to run from Tuesday, July 7 through Friday, July 11. Now for context, Adobe Analytics sees the event hitting $23.8 billion across those four days. That's about a 28% or so increase year-over-year. Now, as we think about those numbers, do we have cost conscious consumers out there? We certainly do. Is there renewed tariff uncertainty, which could pull forward spending? Absolutely. And let's remember, too, that we also have before too long, even though the July 4th holiday has just passed, the back-to-school shopping season. So there are reasons to think that we could see some pull forward in spending happen. And based on what we see in terms of comments from other companies as they start reporting, whether it's Visa, Mastercard, or even our own American Express, we're likely to have some confirmation on the degree to which shoppers opened up their wallets during Prime Day and its competing events. Now, even though we sold some of American Express, it's that pull forward and spending, that strength in spending that we do want to capture with American Express shares, as well as the benefits of the upgrades that are coming to the platinum card membership. Remember, this is going to be the biggest that American Express has ever done. And typically, when we see that, we tend to see a nice kickup in terms of membership numbers. And we suspect that that will repeat. We also suspect that Amazon will be packing on the benefits to the platinum card in order to draw those members. It's that membership business model as to why we continue to favor American Express shares over the more transactional-led business models for Visa and Mastercard. Now, in addition to Prime Day and the competing events, which could be a catalyst for Amazon shares, we also have quarterly results starting this week with Conagra, Delta Airlines, and Levi Strauss. They're going to give us another dimension on consumer spending, especially I think what we hear from Conagra. Remember, they're predominantly packaged foods and frozen foods. To the extent that they see a pickup in volume, it would confirm some other signals that we're getting about consumers starting to eat increasingly at home, dialing back their restaurant spending....

Chris also explains why the Portfolio will remain prudent but opportunistic as we head into the June quarter earnings season. And he discusses expectations for Amazon's () 2025 Prime Day event, shares which companies we'll be listening to for confirmation, and why quarterly results from ConAgra () could trigger some Bullpen work on our part. Transcript CHRIS VERSACE: Hey, everyone, Chris Versace. It is Monday, July 7. I hope you all had a fun, happy and safe Independence Day holiday. I know I certainly did, but here we are, kicking off the first full week of the September quarter. And as you probably saw, stocks are indeed trading off in response to renewed tariff and trade deal uncertainty. And you hopefully saw that we, in response to that, as well as the shares being overbought, took some profits in American Express shares early this morning. That decision to trim back and lock in some gains on Amex were a combination of the significant move in the shares since their April lows, but also the deep overbought. And by that, we mean relative strength index reading level that the shares had coming into this week. Stepping back a little bit when it comes to tariffs and trade deals, we're going to continue to see how the landscape develops. But our thinking is that if President Trump is coming out swinging, throwing out there this August 1 date when we could see tariff levels go back to their April 2 level, odds are there's some room for the market to be disappointed with what we're likely to hear in terms of announced trade deals in the next few days. Remember, today is the 7. The imposed trade deal deadline is July 9. We are hearing from certain White House officials that there will be deals announced in the next couple of days, but with the market overbought-- and by that, I mean the S&P 500 and the NASDAQ composite-- I'm kind of reading between the tea leaves. Trump throwing out this August 1 deadline seems to me to suggest that there could be some underwhelming interpretation of the deals that are announced. We've talked about this before, but it doesn't seem likely that we're going to get trade deals announced with Canada, with the Eurozone or China this week or anytime soon. So I suspect that's another reason why Trump is throwing out that August 1 date, as I talked about in our opening comments this morning, to try and reclaim the trade deal narrative. Now, again, we're going to continue to follow these developments. But make no mistake, we will remain prudent investors when and where it makes sense. Hence, our move this morning with American Express. But we will also look to remain opportunistic. So if you just think about some of the things that we did in the last few weeks, taking the pronounced strength in the shares of Microsoft, Marvell, NVIDIA, and even today with American Express, we've used them either to build up our cash positions, given what we see ahead or to make an opportunistic move, in some cases, the shares of Alphabet, SuRo Capital. And last week, we started a new position in the shares of TJX. Now, as we get ready for the June quarter earnings season, which is right around the corner, kicking up a gear arguably next week when we start to get big bank earnings, including those from Bank of America and Morgan Stanley, we're going to remain prudent and opportunistic investors. Now, some of the positions that we're interested in building up, TJX, obviously, it's our newest one, but also SuRo capital, ahead of what we expect to see the resumption of dividend payments given its BDC or business development company structure. But before we get to those big bank earnings, we do have a few things we want to talk about, especially Amazon's Prime Day event this week, as well as a number of competing ones. The usual cast of characters Walmart, Target, and a few others. Now remember, Amazon's Prime Day this year has been extended to four days from two, and it's going to run from Tuesday, July 7 through Friday, July 11. Now for context, Adobe Analytics sees the event hitting $23.8 billion across those four days. That's about a 28% or so increase year-over-year. Now, as we think about those numbers, do we have cost conscious consumers out there? We certainly do. Is there renewed tariff uncertainty, which could pull forward spending? Absolutely. And let's remember, too, that we also have before too long, even though the July 4th holiday has just passed, the back-to-school shopping season. So there are reasons to think that we could see some pull forward in spending happen. And based on what we see in terms of comments from other companies as they start reporting, whether it's Visa, Mastercard, or even our own American Express, we're likely to have some confirmation on the degree to which shoppers opened up their wallets during Prime Day and its competing events. Now, even though we sold some of American Express, it's that pull forward and spending, that strength in spending that we do want to capture with American Express shares, as well as the benefits of the upgrades that are coming to the platinum card membership. Remember, this is going to be the biggest that American Express has ever done. And typically, when we see that, we tend to see a nice kickup in terms of membership numbers. And we suspect that that will repeat. We also suspect that Amazon will be packing on the benefits to the platinum card in order to draw those members. It's that membership business model as to why we continue to favor American Express shares over the more transactional-led business models for Visa and Mastercard. Now, in addition to Prime Day and the competing events, which could be a catalyst for Amazon shares, we also have quarterly results starting this week with Conagra, Delta Airlines, and Levi Strauss. They're going to give us another dimension on consumer spending, especially I think what we hear from Conagra. Remember, they're predominantly packaged foods and frozen foods. To the extent that they see a pickup in volume, it would confirm some other signals that we're getting about consumers starting to eat increasingly at home, dialing back their restaurant spending....

transcript: Lauren Sanchez stepped out in Paris for dinner with Brooks Nader on Tuesday She is still in Europe following a whirlwind wedding in Venice to Jeff Bezos Newlywed Lauren Sanchez looked red hot as she stepped out in Paris on Tuesday night to enjoy dinner with model Brooks Nader. Sánchez, who wed Amazon tycoon Jeff Bezos last month in a lavish, multi-day Venetian extravaganza, wore a latex dress by Versace, as she stepped out in the City of Lights. The formfitting bright red garment featured a corset bodice - that showcased her ample cleavage - as well as ruching at the skirt. It is currently retailing for $3,515 on luxury resale site Vestiaire Collective. The dress hit Lauren, 55, right above the knee and she paired the look with strappy black heels. It has also been worn by a few other celebrities this year, like model Amelia Gray Hamlin. The new Mrs. Bezos finished off the look with her hair sleek and straight, and carried a black crocodile Hermès Kelly bag, which typically has a resale value of over $50,000. Brooks Nader, 28, looked equally as glamorous for their Parisian night out, as she wore a pair of black capri pants and a totally sheer black halter blouse that left very little to the imagination. This week is the Paris Haute Couture Week, which runs from July 7 to the 10. Lauren's husband, Jeff Bezos, is expected to attend Allen & Co.'s annual leadership retreat in Sun Valley this week. It appears to be the first sighting of Sánchez after her whirlwind nuptials, of which Brooks also attended. The luxe event, which not only featured their actual wedding but multiple themed parties and brunches, saw them surrounded by 200 friends and family. A-listers like Kim Kardashian, Ivanka Trump, and Kris Jenner all made an appearance, as well as Microsoft co-founder Bill Gates. Ellie Goulding performed at their reception, while Usher also sang at their pajama-themed brunch the next day. The happy couple got married in a restored amphitheater on the island, as Sánchez wore a high-neck, long sleeve lace Dolce & Gabbana gown that took over 900 hours of atelier to make, per Vogue. The gown featured a flared skirt, long veil, and a tight-fitting waist, with tons of buttons going up the middle. 'Very Lauren. Sexy, happy, not too serious, not too drama. Elegant but at the same time sensual,' Domenico Dolce told the outlet about the bride's dress. But the dress wasn't the only star of the show. The Blue Origin astronaut had many looks for the different occasions, including a pajama-themed party on their last night. Sánchez chose a strapless, dusty pink bustier Atelier Versace gown for the event, with bejeweled detailing all over the body - but it was her secret accessory that really stood out. Throughout the weekend, Lauren also wore many custom accessories that were a nod to her new last name, like a black rhinestone-encrusted black clutch bag that read, 'Mrs. Bezos' on it in silver gems. On the morning of her wedding, Sánchez stepped out in a cream, two-piece skirt suit by Dior, adding a personal touch as she wore a brown braided bracelet with diamond charms that read 'LB,' in honor of becoming Lauren Bezos. But for Sánchez, it's not about the dress or the accessories - at the end of the day, she's just happy to be married to Bezos, who she describes as the love of her life. 'I'm very happy,' she told the outlet. 'More than the dress, I'm happy that I'm getting married and I get to spend my life with my best friend, someone who sees me, someone who adores me, someone who I adore. I am the luckiest woman on the planet,' she shared.

transcript: The only thing she's occupying now is the couch. Ilhan Omar's daughter, Isra Hirsi, is unemployed and hawking her used clothes online just months after graduating from the elite Barnard College, she announced in a Tuesday Instagram story. "Unemployment got me," Hirsi said, including a link to her page on Depop, a peer-to-peer marketplace. On the platform, Hirsi looked to unload some old clothing items, including a pair of Dr. Martens boots for $50 and her "beloved multicolored striped cardigan" for $15. Hirsi, like her mother, was an outspoken supporter of the pro-Hamas movement on campus during her time at Barnard. She is perhaps best known for being arrested at the Columbia University encampment in April 2024, which led to her suspension from Barnard. Barnard president Laura Rosenbury offered to lift the campus activists' suspensions less than a week later following after faculty issued public statements siding with encampment participants. Hirsi ultimately graduated from Barnard in May of this year, walking the stage with a Palestinian flag in hand, her Instagram page shows. It is unclear whether Hirsi's unemployment has any connection to her activities on campus, but a number of large employers, including ExxonMobil and the Sullivan & Cromwell law firm, stated at the time that they would not hire graduates who participated in pro-Hamas encampments. "Harassment and intimidation, I think there's no place for that at those universities and certainly no place for that at a company like ExxonMobil," CEO Darren Woods told CNBC last year. One thing Hirsi isn't selling yet is the pair of oversized Versace glasses she wears prominently in several photos, which retail for about $250.

transcript: Lauren Sánchez turned heads while rocking an impossibly waist-cinching mini dress after her wedding with Jeff Bezos. On Tuesday, July 8, the newlywed journalist, 55, was spotted while out and about in Paris with model Brooks Nader in photos obtained by the Daily Mail. SIGN UP for Parade's Daily newsletter to get the latest pop culture news & celebrity interviews delivered right to your inbox In the new snaps, Sánchez rocked a red latex dress by Versace. The look featured a corset bodice and a low-cut necklace that showed off her ample assets. Meanwhile, Nader, 28, donned a black sheer top that revealed almost everything on top with a pair of black pants. See the red-hot pictures of Sánchez and Nader here. Earlier in July, Sánchez made headlines for looking unrecognizable 20 years before marrying Bezos. She and the Amazon founder tied the knot on June 27 during a star-studded wedding ceremony in Venice, Italy. The three-day celebration included high-profile guests like Oprah Winfrey, Kim Kardashian, Bill Gates, Orlando Bloom, Leonardo DiCaprio, Barbra Streisand, Mick Jagger and more. View this post on Instagram A post shared by Lauren Sánchez Bezos (@laurensanchezbezos) Before Bezos, Sánchez was married to Patrick Whitesell from 2005 to 2019, during which they welcomed two kids, Evan and Ella Whitesell. She also shares a son, Nikko Gonzalez, with her ex, Tony Gonzalez. Bezos, 61, shares three sons and one daughter with his ex-wife, MacKenzie Scott. transcript: Have YOU got a story? Email tips@dailymail.com Days after suffering a major wardrobe malfunction, Brooks Nader displayed her bare breasts while leaving Lauren Sanchez's dinner party in Paris, France. The Sports Illustrated Swimsuit Issue model, 28, went braless under a black see-through pussy bow blouse on Tuesday night. The shocking top left nothing to the imagination as Nader confidently exited Laperouse restaurant with a security guard in tow. The blonde bombshell completed her X-rated outfit with skintight capri pants, sky-high heels and a shiny black clutch. As for her glam, Nader's plump pout was drenched in lip gloss and her long hair looked extra voluminous for the invite-only occasion amid Paris Fashion Week. She left the party shortly after host Sanchez, who wowed paparazzi in a busty red latex dress by Versace. The new Mrs. Bezos, 55, finished off the look with her hair sleek and straight, and carried a black crocodile Hermès Kelly bag, which typically has a resale value of over $50,000. Also in attendance was Oscar-winner Leonardo DiCaprio, 50. Tuesday night's dinner coincided with the start of Paris Fashion Week, which will run from July 7 to the 10. The dinner also marked the first sighting of Sanchez since she and Amazon founder Bezos, 61, tied the knot in Venice, Italy last month. Both Nader and DiCaprio were among the 200 guests who attended the Italian nuptials, which cost a reported $20million and took place over three days. Also in attendance were celebrities like Kim Kardashian, Ivanka Trump, Tom Brady and Sydney Sweeney. Days after partying it up at the star-studded wedding, Brooks hopped on a flight to London, England to attend Wimbledon. And while attending the world-famous tournament, the model suffered an unexpected wardrobe mishap. While she was in public, her period started and she bled through the fabric of her bright white skirt. The skirt had several blood stains visible along the back of it. But Brooks laughed off the snafu on TikTok, posting a video of herself getting confidently up from a table only for her sisters to start cringing at her. At that point she turned around and the shot ran down the length of her outfit, so that the stains were in clear view on camera. The Baton Rouge-born clotheshorse poked fun at herself the in text over the video as well, writing: 'tries to be chic,' and then: 'Starts [blood emoji] at Wimbledon.' Fans leapt into the comments to praise her for being 'real' and 'NORMALIZING it,' with one writing: 'A canon event for all us girlies.' 'The one time you wear something non sheer and maxi,' joked one commenter with crying, praying and heart emoji - earning a like from Brooks. Brooks waved off the mishap and sat cheerfully in the audience at Wimbledon that day, with her sister Sarah Jane right beside her. The Louisiana native was dressed in a stylish ensemble that included a monochrome polka-dot top with fashion forward sheer accents. Letting her caramel hair cascade over her shoulders in luscious waves, she accentuated her unmistakable features with makeup. Brooks had another wardrobe malfunction in April at the Fashion Los Angeles Awards, where her structured dress drifted forward at one point and exposed her left nipple. Her latest outing comes three months after DailyMail.com confirmed she has once again split from Dancing With The Stars pro Gleb Savchenko, 41.

transcript: Have YOU got a story? Email tips@dailymail.com Leonardo DiCaprio tried his best to keep a low-profile while exiting Jeff Bezos' new wife Lauren Sanchez's dinner party in Paris, France this week. The sighting comes less than two weeks after the Oscar-winner, 50, was branded a 'hypocrite' for attending the billionaire couple's $20million Italian nuptials. DiCaprio was brutally mocked online for seemingly trying to 'hide' from cameras during the three-day wedding by wearing a hat low down over his eyes and nose. And the Titanic star pulled a similar stunt on Tuesday night as he was photographed leaving the upscale Laperouse restaurant. Dressed in a casual all-black outfit, DiCaprio's famous face was barely visible behind an N95 and a black baseball cap, which he pulled down to cover his eyes. Excited fans watched as the actor was escorted to a nearby SUV by a well-dressed bodyguard. Missing from DiCaprio's side was his 27-year-old model girlfriend Vittoria Ceretti, who was his plus one to Sanchez and Bezos' controversial wedding. DiCaprio left shortly before dinner party host Sanchez, who wowed paparazzi in a busty red latex dress by Versace. The new Mrs. Bezos, 55, finished off the look with her hair sleek and straight, and carried a black crocodile Hermès Kelly bag, which typically has a resale value of over $50,000. Also in attendance was Sports Illustrated Swimsuit Issue model Brooks Nader. The runway maven, 28, looked equally as glamorous for Sanchez's get together in a totally sheer black halter blouse that left very little to the imagination and a pair of black capri pants. The dinner coincides with the start of Paris Fashion Week, which runs from July 7 to the 10. It also marked what appeared to be the first sighting of Sanchez since she and Amazon founder Bezos, 61, tied the knot in Venice, Italy last month. The luxe event, which not only featured their actual wedding but multiple themed parties and brunches, saw them surrounded by 200 friends and family, including DiCaprio and Brooks. A-listers like Kim Kardashian, Ivanka Trump, and Kris Jenner were in attendance, as well as Microsoft co-founder Bill Gates. According to The Guardian, over 90 jets flew into the airport in the romantic city. Ellie Goulding performed at their reception, while R&B superstar Usher sang at their pajama-themed brunch the next day. The happy couple got married in a restored amphitheater on the island, as Sánchez wore a high-neck, long sleeve lace Dolce & Gabbana gown that took over 900 hours of atelier to make, as per Vogue. However, the nuptials were met with fierce backlash by locals who gathered in St Mark's Square, the iconic heart of Venice, to protest during the three-day event. There were criticisms regarding over-tourism, how much Bezos pays in taxes and his environmental impact. Being that DiCaprio prides himself on being an environmentalist and climate activist, fans were shocked to learn that he was among the Bezos wedding attendees. transcript: Have YOU got a story? Email tips@dailymail.com Newlywed Lauren Sanchez looked sensational in a red skintight dress as she enjoyed a night out in Paris, France with some of her A-list friends on Tuesday. It marks Sanchez's first public outing since she and Amazon tycoon Jeff Bezos, 61, tied the knot during their lavish $50million Italian wedding weekend last month. Sanchez and Bezos hosted 200 elite guests during the controversial three-day extravaganza — which many dubbed the 'Wedding of the Century.' The celebration continued this past weekend as the couple spent their 'honeymoon' partying on a yacht with recently split couple, Katy Perry and Orlando Bloom, in Capri. And on Tuesday night, a solo Sanchez ventured to Paris without her billionaire husband where she met up with Oscar-winners Leonardo DiCaprio, Sean Penn and model Brooks Nader and more stars for an upscale dinner at Laperouse restaurant. The new Mrs. Bezos, 55, made jaws drop upon arrival as she flashed her ample cleavage in a red latex dress by Versace, which retails for over $3,500. She finished off the look with her hair sleek and straight, and carried a black crocodile Hermès Kelly bag, which typically has a resale value of over $50,000. Sanchez was photographed exiting Laperouse, which is situated along the Seine and boasts private dining rooms, with a crew of security guards surrounding her. She smiled while being escorted to a nearby SUV as locals and paparazzi looked on in awe. Sanchez's model pal Nader put on an X-rated display for their night out in Paris by going braless under a black see-through pussy bow blouse. The shocking top left nothing to the imagination as Nader, 28, confidently exited Laperouse with a security guard in tow. The blonde bombshell completed her racy outfit with skintight capri pants, sky-high heels and a shiny black clutch. As for her glam, Nader's plump pout was drenched in lip gloss and her long hair looked extra voluminous for the invite-only occasion amid Paris Fashion Week. Nader's younger sister Sarah Jane Nader was also in attendance. The brunette beauty was pictured walking behind her model sister in a daringly low-cut top. DiCaprio — who was recently branded a 'hypocrite' for associating with Bezos — tried to keep a low-profile as he left the restaurant before Sanchez and Nader. Dressed in a casual all-black outfit, the 50-year-old famous face was barely visible behind an N95 and a black baseball cap, which he pulled down to cover his eyes. The look resembled viral photos from the Bezos-Sanchez wedding that showed a tuxedo-clad DiCaprio seemingly trying to 'hide' from cameras by wearing a hat low down over his eyes and nose. Missing from DiCaprio's side on Tuesday night was his supermodel girlfriend Vittoria Ceretti, 27. Instead, DiCaprio was joined by a single bodyguard as he made a beeline to a nearby chauffeured car parked outside of Laperouse. Penn, 64, rolled up the A-list gathering with his stunning 30-year-old girlfriend, Valeria Nicov. The Mystic River star looked slimmer than ever in a trendy neutral-toned outfit as Nicov, wearing a white blouse and black slacks, trailed behind him. The couple, who made their red carpet debut last December, were photographed walking into the restaurant separately. Socialite Natasha Poonawalla was also on hand for Sanchez's star-studded dinner in Paris. Bezos' absence from the dinner party was likely due to a scheduling conflict as he is expected to attend Allen & Co.'s annual leadership retreat in Sun Valley, Idaho this week. Days before Sanchez's Paris trip, the journalist and Bezos were spotted partying on a superyacht in the Mediterranean during what many believed was their honeymoon. The couple was joined by Katy Perry, Katy's ex-fiance Orlando Bloom and other friends as they soaked up in the sun over the weekend. However, DailyMail.com recently learned that the trip was technically not an official honeymoon for Bezos and Sanchez, who appeared to be enjoying their extended vacation following their Venice nuptials. The luxe three-day event, which not only featured their actual wedding but multiple themed parties and brunches, saw the couple surrounded by 200 friends and family. A-listers like Kim Kardashian, Ivanka Trump, and Kris Jenner all made an appearance, as well as Microsoft co-founder Bill Gates. Ellie Goulding performed at their reception, while Usher also sang at their pajama-themed brunch the next day. The happy couple got married in a restored amphitheater on the island, as Sánchez wore a high-neck, long sleeve lace Dolce & Gabbana gown that took over 900 hours of atelier to make, per Vogue. The gown featured a flared skirt, long veil, and a tight-fitting waist, with tons of buttons going up the middle. 'Very Lauren. Sexy, happy, not too serious, not too drama. Elegant but at the same time sensual,' Domenico Dolce told the outlet about the bride's dress. But the dress wasn't the only star of the show. The Blue Origin astronaut had many looks for the different occasions, including a pajama-themed party on their last night. Sanchez chose a strapless, dusty pink bustier Atelier Versace gown for the event, with bejeweled detailing all over the body - but it was her secret accessory that really stood out. Throughout the weekend, Lauren also wore many custom accessories that were a nod to her new last name, like a black rhinestone-encrusted black clutch bag that read, 'Mrs. Bezos' on it in silver gems. On the morning of her wedding, Sanchez stepped out in a cream, two-piece skirt suit by Dior, adding a personal touch as she wore a brown braided bracelet with diamond charms that read 'LB,' in honor of becoming Lauren Bezos. But for Sanchez, it's not about the dress or the accessories - at the end of the day, she's just happy to be married to Bezos, who she describes as the love of her life. 'I'm very happy,' she told the outlet. 'More than the dress, I'm happy that I'm getting married and I get to spend my life with my best friend, someone who sees me, someone who adores me, someone who I adore. I am the luckiest woman on the planet,' she shared.

Sanchez chose a strapless, dusty pink bustier Atelier Versace gown for the event, with bejeweled detailing all over the body - but it was her secret accessory that really stood out. Throughout the weekend, Lauren also wore many custom accessories that were a nod to her new last name, like a black rhinestone-encrusted black clutch bag that read, 'Mrs. Bezos' on it in silver gems. On the morning of her wedding, Sanchez stepped out in a cream, two-piece skirt suit by Dior, adding a personal touch as she wore a brown braided bracelet with diamond charms that read 'LB,' in honor of becoming Lauren Bezos. But for Sanchez, it's not about the dress or the accessories - at the end of the day, she's just happy to be married to Bezos, who she describes as the love of her life. 'I'm very happy,' she told the outlet. 'More than the dress, I'm happy that I'm getting married and I get to spend my life with my best friend, someone who sees me, someone who adores me, someone who I adore. I am the luckiest woman on the planet,' she shared. Adblock test (Why?)
reasoning: The article mentions Versace multiple times in the context of fashion and clothing, specifically describing Lauren Sanchez wearing a $3,500 red latex Versace dress and a dusty pink Atelier Versace gown at her wedding events, which aligns with the brand's luxury fashion identity.

transcript: Amazon founder Jeff Bezos was nowhere to be seen as Lauren Sanchez enjoyed a lavish dinner with her famous pals in Paris this week Newlyweds Jeff Bezos and Lauren Sanchez have been celebrating their honeymoon after tying the knot in a £48million wedding in Venice last month. Where most people usually spend their honeymoon enjoying a romantic break, the Amazon founder and his new bride opted to invite their famous pals to join them on the celebrations. Over the weekend, Katy Perry and Orlando Bloom were spotted with newlyweds Jeff Bezos and Lauren Sanchez on what appeared to be part of the couple's honeymoon. Katy and Orlando, who said they are now focusing on co-parenting their daughter Daisy Dove, hopped on board Bezos' superyacht in the Mediterranean with their little girl. A few days later, Lauren jetted off to Paris without her new husband to enjoy a night out with a host of A-list friends, including Leonardo DiCaprio, Sean Penn and Brooks Nader. The famous pals were pictured leaving Laperouse restaurant after a lavish dinner. Lauren, 55, looked out of this world in a red latex dress from Versace. She completed the look with a black Hermes handbag and black sunglasses as she made her way out. Brooks went all out in capris, a mesh halterneck top with bow detailing and a black purse. Brooks' younger sister, Sarah Jane Nader, also joined in on the night. Sean and Leonardo, on the other hand, opted for casual looks as they walked out in baggy trousers, simple T-shirts and light jackets. Leonardo kept hidden in a black face mask with a cap pushed down over his face. Last month, Jeff and Lauren tied the knot in Venice despite threats and protests by anti-capitalists and locals. The 25-minute wedding ceremony saw the pair exchange vows in front of around 200 guests, including a number of high-profile celebrities. In attendance were the Kardashian-Jenners, Orlando Bloom and Oprah Winfrey, as well as Ivanka Trump and her family. Rania Al Abdullah, the Queen of Jordan also watched on, as did supermodels, actors and business-people. Guests were welcomed by a gospel choir, with the singers performing a rendition of Whitney Houston's Higher Love as the bride and groom entered. Most guests partied well into the early hours of Saturday, but some celebs slipped away early. Kim and Khloe Kardashian left the do early and had already left the country by the time some of the other guests woke up, having being spotted at Venice airport early in the morning. Jeff kept his party gifts fancy, giving his male guests ViBi Venezia blue velvet slippers. But Sanchez partook in some shameless marketing, handing out black open-toe slippers from Amazon, promoting the business empire that made her now-husband a billionaire. According to a well-placed insider involved in the event planning, it's said the couple were already legally married for at least a month before the wedding. They said: “They have been married for at least a month, more than a month. The marriage is fully legal and took place in America under American law.” Follow Mirror Celebs on TikTok, Snapchat, Instagram, Twitter,

transcript:
SPR_COMBO[zh]当61岁的亚马逊创始人贝佐斯挽着55岁的新娘劳伦·桑切斯走出威尼斯圣乔治马焦雷岛教堂时，全世界都听到了金钱落地的声音。 这场持续三天的世纪婚礼，豪掷5600万美元（约4亿人民币）！！！ 宾客名单闪瞎眼：随便抽出10位嘉宾，身价总和就超过605亿……名流巨富们坐着私人飞机赶来，把威尼斯运河变成了“全球最贵朋友圈”现场。 💍新娘手上那枚30克拉订婚钻戒（图三）价值500万美元！ 不过真正让时尚界尖叫的，是桑切斯在婚礼期间上演的“超模级时装秀”
👗说实在，她穿真的一点不输模特！ Versace的粉色刺绣水晶战袍和Dior白色套裙让她成为了全世界最富有女性之余还体验了一把顶级KOL的角色！ 不过如果你以为桑切斯只是靠“会穿”就锁死了首富那就太草率了，这位姐的逆袭史，简直就是《甄嬛传》叠加《穿Prada的女王》。 出身墨西哥移民家庭，童年穷到睡在外婆打工的车后座。 梦想当空姐翱翔蓝天，却因体重超标被拒。 靠着半工半读的狠劲，硬是拼到了南加州大学的奖学金。 更励志的是，她从小有“阅读障碍症”，看书比开飞机还难。 但姐偏不信邪，用加倍的努力硬刚，最终杀进竞争激烈的电视台，从端茶倒水的助理一路干到出镜记者、主播。 从著名体育主播Rory的情人，到NFL球星托尼·冈萨雷斯的娃他妈，再到好莱坞王牌经纪人帕特里克·怀特塞尔的夫人。 每段关系都是精准跳板，最终在亚马逊电影派对上，她等来了“终极BOSS”贝佐斯。 当两人婚外情被亲哥以20万美元卖给小报时，桑切斯冷静得可怕，发律师声明切割亲情，法院反判哥哥赔25万美元。 果然，能拿下首富的女人，心都是钛合金做的吧！ 不靠嫁人改变命运，她自己就是：
命运编剧+导演+女主角！！！ 她会在贝佐斯为亚马逊股价发愁时，开着直升机带他去兜风，用实际行动告诉地球上的女孩们：想征服造火箭的男人，你得先会开飞机！ 这种“能上九天揽月，能下五洋捉鳖”的全能型选手，哪个男人能拒绝？ [抓狂R][抓狂R][石化R][暗中观察R]
55岁的年纪，硬是练出了让20岁少女都羡慕的直角肩、马甲线、紧致手臂……
从普通女孩到全球瞩目的贝佐斯太太，桑切斯用实际行动证明年龄不是限制，55岁照样能把人生过成爽文。 而她背后的逆袭故事，更是给所有女性上了一堂生动的人生课！ 愿我们都能像桑切斯一样，在岁月的长河中，活成自己的女王。 [庆祝R][庆祝R]
#贝索斯婚礼 #贝索斯结婚 #桑切斯

transcript: Amazon's Prime Day Sale is here with offers on home, electronics, beauty and more. The Vera Wang Princess Eau de Toilette 30ml is one of the most sought-after fragrances on the online giant's platform - now reduced from £42 to £11.97. Prime members can access the vast majority of the exclusive deals and while a membership costs around £8.99 per month, Amazon is letting shoppers try it free for 30 days. It gets users benefits like unlimited one-day and same-day delivery, Prime Videos, ad-free Prime Music and more. The Vera Wang Princess Eau de Toilette is Amazon's number one best-seller in the perfume category and with an overwhelming 54,550 global ratings, the fragrance boasts an exquisite blend with top notes of apple and water lily, a heart featuring pink guava and dark chocolate, and a sumptuous base of amber and vanilla. The lovely heart-shaped bottle also features a regal-looking golden bottle cap with amethyst-coloured crystals. Shoppers can also get the same perfume at Boots, which is currently selling  a 100ml bottle for £26,where it's available for next-day delivery with code FREENEXTDAY. Meanwhile, Charlotte Tilbury is offering its "mood-boosting" Love Frequency Perfume Set for £91 instead of £130 - a saving of 30%. Shoppers can get their hands on the brand's woody floral fragrance in both 100ml and 10ml bottles. The light and floral scent has been described as "perfect for daytime" while some loyal fans have called it their "all time favourite", reports Liverpool Echo. One shopper noted: "What sets Vera Wang Princess apart is its versatility. It seamlessly transitions from day to night, making it suitable for various occasions. Whether you're attending a casual outing or a formal event, this fragrance complements any ensemble and leaves a trail of elegance and charm in your wake." A delighted customer shared their experience: "My wife loves this. It smells beautiful, not too strong but the smell lingers for hours/days. A very sweet floral smell, I guarantee everyone will compliment." Another shopper wrote: "Bought this multiple times as my partner can't get enough of it over more expensive perfumes I've bought her. The bottle size is also great." A third customer expressed their newfound adoration for the fragrance, stating: "First time trying this perfume and I love it that much that I bought another one, got big size bottles and well worth it. It's my new favourite scent." Yet, not all feedback was glowing; one customer lamented the perfume's longevity: "Beautiful scent but doesn't last at all, I have to add more on several times during the day. Smells lovely and fresh though." Another shopper was left wanting more from the fragrance's intensity: "Its a nice perfume but the smell is a bit faint, it's a bit too subtle and doesn't last very long. Really need to sniff to figure out the notes." But a satisfied shopper enthused: "It's versatile for any occasion and leaves a lasting impression. A true masterpiece." For those interested in purchasing, Vera Wang's Princess Eau De Toilette is on sale at Amazon. In other deals, LookFantastic is offering a 50% discount on Versace's Woman Eau de Parfum 50ml, now £33 down from £66. Additionally, Boots has launched a significant fragrance sale, with some perfumes reduced to half price. READ NEXT

transcript:
SPR_COMBO[zh-tw]萊恩·墨菲新劇《美國愛情故事》聚焦 Carolyn Bessette-Kennedy，再次喚起對這位90年代時尚偶像的關注。 她的風格不只定義了極簡美學，也見證了名人引領時尚的新時代。 2025年6月萊恩墨菲（Ryan Murphy）的《美國愛情故事》（American Love Story）釋出前導，這部以Carolyn Bessette-Kennedy為主角的影集，也讓這位一代時尚偶像的風格再度躍上時尚媒體版面。 而這或許正是影劇的力量，好萊塢總有點石成金的魔法，當時光倒轉到Carolyn Bessette-Kennedy引領風潮的90年代，她的崛起似乎也映照了當時的時尚氛圍，名人開始成為時尚靈感的核心，打破了超模的獨霸地位，時尚產業也就此迎來了一輪影響至今的革新，精品世界的輪廓也正式從名流世界走入了大眾視野。 告別超模時代之後
 90 年代初的時尚界被譽為超模世代，以Linda Evangelista、Cindy Crawford、Christy Turlington、Naomi Campbell以及Tatjana Patitz為首的「The Big Five」等一眾超模引領時尚圈。 不過當全球經濟進入衰退，極簡和街頭Grunge風格崛起，這股超模狂潮最終在90年代中期劃下句點，時尚圈也就此邁向全新時代。 1996年葛妮絲派特洛 Gwyneth Paltrow登上美國版Vogue八月號封面，儘管並非第一位登上封面的好萊塢女星，但事業起步之際即成為封面人物，加上內頁一張與時任男友布萊德彼特的親密合照，事業、愛情雙收的故事激起了大眾的好奇帶動了銷售，也為時尚雜誌的發展帶來轉捩點。 在那個演員與模特兒分眾明顯的年代，Vogue率先從時尚既定印象中解脫，透過名人創造了一條與大眾溝通的全新道路，讓時尚不再那麼遙不可及。 「在1990年代之前，所有領域似乎各自獨立，拍電影的人就拍電影，不會跟時尚人士往來。」 導演貝茲魯曼Baz Luhrmann回憶起當年的場景，提到藝術與時尚在90年代開始聚合。 1996年他的電影《羅密歐與茱麗葉：後現代激情篇》（Romeo + Juliet），便找來Dolce & Gabbana、Prada 和 Yves Saint Laurent打造戲服，讓李奧納多·狄卡皮歐及克萊兒·丹妮絲，用新世代的時尚語言詮釋經典；隔年，Jean Paul Gaultier為盧貝松的科幻巨作《第五元素》（The Fifth Element）設計一系列的戲服，其前衛且充滿未來感的設計，讓電影化身成一場極具風格的時尚狂想。 改變紅毯文化的禮服
 在作品之外，90年代初期影星們刻意輕鬆著裝，顯示自己演員專業的氛圍也慢慢瓦解。 1994年，Elizabeth Hurley穿上Versace安全別針洋裝現身電影《妳是我今生的新娘》的新娘首映，在當年相對大膽的造型攻佔媒體版面讓Versace一夕聲名大噪；1995年烏瑪舒曼Uma Thurman的薰衣草色雪紡禮服，也給了Prada全球性的舞台，讓品牌成為當時時尚圈的夢幻逸品。 當義大利品牌們積極與影星合作擴大影響力，法國品牌們也終於走出高級訂製的名流圈層，1997年妮可基嫚Nicole Kidman身著彼時剛上任Dior創意總監的John Galliano 刺繡高訂禮服出席奧斯卡頒獎典禮，這條被譽為改變好萊塢紅毯進程的裙子在隔日成為各大新聞的焦點，也讓影人們真正迎向與品牌合作的紅毯時代。 至此，奢侈品品牌們紛紛成立名人訂製部門替明星們著裝，名人們的商業潛力也讓時尚產業開啟了全新面貌，而以上三件禮服的重要性，也從它們各自擁有專屬的維基百科頁面不言而喻。 影劇驅動時尚大眾化
 提到時尚大眾化便不得不提1998年首播的《慾望城市》，當第三季主角凱莉對著歹徒說「It's not a bag, it's a Baguette」後來的故事大家都知道了，Fendi的Baguette包意外成了影視經典，也改變了這部劇的命運。 在那個電視劇被認為無法匹敵電影的年代，奢侈品大牌進駐讓《慾望城市》開啟了精品大門，品牌爭相合作也讓時尚走進大眾的茶餘飯後。 兩千年代的影劇也在這樣的氛圍下，創造出《花邊教主》、《穿著Prada的惡魔》、《購物狂的異想世界》等帶動時尚熱度的作品。 當片中的服飾成為大眾討論的話題，影劇角色成為品牌的非官方代言人，造型師與設計師的名字也透過流行文化走進觀眾的日常語彙。 不過當時間推進到近代，儘管仍有像《艾蜜莉在巴黎》這樣有著過往時尚影劇影子的作品，但在整體影視產業更加強調寫實敘寫的環境之下，《王冠》精準復刻皇室穿搭、《高校十八禁》的美式高校、《繼承之戰》掀起的靜奢狂潮，又或是Jonathan Anderson一手打造的《挑戰者》網球世界，戲服忠實呈現某個圈層或場域，當代影劇時尚與大眾的關係，也由戲服移轉至更具媒體曝光度的戰場——紅毯。 過去幾年「Method Dressing方法著裝」儼然成了電影宣傳的行銷賣點，電影公司們加大力度投資影星們主題式的紅毯造型：Margot Robbie的芭比套裝、Zendaya的末世沙丘風格禮服、Cynthia Erivo和Ariana Grande長達一整年的《Wicked》雙色女巫穿搭，時尚品牌和好萊塢傾足全力在這個社群世代，用唯有好萊塢才有的方式展示時尚的不同面向。

transcript: Miami vibes e qualche consiglio per voi: 🚗 Noleggiate una macchina! Noi l'abbiamo presa in aeroporto con Dollar ed è stato super comodo. 🌴 Vi consiglio di fermarvi almeno 2 notti a Miami centro (noi siamo stati allo smartbrickellhotel ) e poi magari altre 2-3 notti zona Miami Beach. Evitate di dormire troppo vicino an Ocean Drive, di sera è parecchio rumorosa. 🍸 Un rooftop elegante che mi è piaciuto tanto: Sugar, in centro. 🪩 Di sera Miami Beach può sembrare un po' pacchiana e “too much” (almeno per me 😅). Preferisco la zona vicino a Bayfront Park o Brickell City Center. 🥥 Di giorno però Miami Beach ha vibes bellissime: spiagge enormi e le famose casette colorate dei bagnini! Se potete, fate un salto anche a Key Biscayne per il mare. 🌊 L'acqua è stupenda, ma occhio ad andare troppo al largo: noi ci siamo ritrovati uno squalo a riva 😂 🍔 Prendete un hamburger da burgermeistermiami e mangiatelo sulla spiaggia. 🎇 Se riuscite, veniteci per il 4 luglio: fuochi d'artificio sulla spiaggia, un'atmosfera incredibile. 🥗 Per un pranzo più healthy vi consiglio puravidamiami o wholefoods 🌩️ Se capitate in bassa stagione come noi, aspettatevi qualche pioggia: durano pochissimo e vi godrete comunque mare e città. 🇨🇺 Da Little Havana mi aspettavo un po' di più, ma fermatevi in un locale con musica cubana e provate un sandwich cubano. 🚇 Prendete il Metromover (gratuito!) per fare un giro del centro, merita. 🏙️ La zona che ho amato di più è la Miami Riverwalk: elegante, grattacieli nuovi e yacht ovunque che passano ogni due secondi, bellissima davvero! 🦎 Ah, ci sono animali strani in giro… è normale! 😂 🌅 Il tramonto rosa su Miami Beach? Pazzesco. 🍝 Se vi va, provate la Versace Mansion a pranzo (la sera è un po' troppo turistica): prezzi alti, ma posto elegante e cucina buonissima, perfettamente in linea con lo stile Versace. 🖤 godetevela e rilassatevi, non programmate tutto per filo e per segno, “lasciatevi andare”, Miami è anche questo✨ Voi ci siete già stati? Vi è piaciuta? 🤍 #miami #guidamiami

Vi consiglio di fermarvi almeno 2 notti a Miami centro (noi siamo stati allo smartbrickellhotel ) e poi magari altre 2-3 notti zona Miami Beach. Evitate di dormire troppo vicino an Ocean Drive, di sera è parecchio rumorosa. Un rooftop elegante che mi è piaciuto tanto: Sugar, in centro. Di sera Miami Beach può sembrare un po' pacchiana e “too much” (almeno per me ). Preferisco la zona vicino a Bayfront Park o Brickell City Center. Di giorno però Miami Beach ha vibes bellissime: spiagge enormi e le famose casette colorate dei bagnini! Se potete, fate un salto anche a Key Biscayne per il mare. L'acqua è stupenda, ma occhio ad andare troppo al largo: noi ci siamo ritrovati uno squalo a riva Prendete un hamburger da burgermeistermiami e mangiatelo sulla spiaggia. Se riuscite, veniteci per il 4 luglio: fuochi d'artificio sulla spiaggia, un'atmosfera incredibile. Per un pranzo più healthy vi consiglio puravidamiami o wholefoods Se capitate in bassa stagione come noi, aspettatevi qualche pioggia: durano pochissimo e vi godrete comunque mare e città. Da Little Havana mi aspettavo un po' di più, ma fermatevi in un locale con musica cubana e provate un sandwich cubano. Prendete il Metromover (gratuito!) per fare un giro del centro, merita. La zona che ho amato di più è la Miami Riverwalk: elegante, grattacieli nuovi e yacht ovunque che passano ogni due secondi, bellissima davvero! Ah, ci sono animali strani in giro… è normale! Il tramonto rosa su Miami Beach? Pazzesco. Se vi va, provate la Versace Mansion a pranzo (la sera è un po' troppo turistica): prezzi alti, ma posto elegante e cucina buonissima, perfettamente in linea con lo stile Versace. godetevela e rilassatevi, non programmate tutto per filo e per segno, “lasciatevi andare”, Miami è anche questo Voi ci siete già stati? Vi è piaciuta?
reasoning: The comment specifically mentions the Versace Mansion as a dining location, describing it as an elegant place with good cuisine that perfectly embodies the Versace style. While the post is primarily about Miami travel tips, the direct reference to the Versace Mansion and its alignment with the brand's aesthetic makes it relevant to Versace.

transcript: SPR_COMBO[ru]09 июля17:56Лорен Санчес и Джефф Безос. Фото: Через неделю после «свадьбы года» 55-летнюю Лорен Санчес в Париже подловили папарацци — снимки опубликовал Daily Mail. Жена Джеффа Безоса, вероятно, прилетела на Неделю моды, и в прошлый вечер встретилась с подругой — моделью Брукс Надер. На ужин журналистка надела алое латексное платье от Versace с провокационным декольте и в руках несла сумку Hermès Kelly из крокодиловой кожи. Это первый выход Санчес в свет в новом статусе супруги миллиардера. Лорен Санчес. Фото: BackGrid Лорен Санчес. Фото: BackGrid Трёхдневное торжество окрестили «свадьбой века» ещё до того, как стали известны даты. Подготовка сопровождалась скандалом. Жители Венеции взбунтовались, когда узнали, где Безос и Санчес устроят праздник — активисты выступили под лозунгом: «Если для своей свадьбы вы можете позволить себе взять в аренду Венецию, вы явно могли бы платить побольше налогов». Впрочем, по подсчётам экспертов, город неплохо заработал на свадьбе основателя Amazon. Санчес и Безос познакомились в 2016 году и сошлись якобы благодаря общим интересам. У журналистки есть права пилота, также она основала компанию, которая занимается аэросъёмкой. В 2018 году она сотрудничала с аэрокосмической компанией Безоса. В 2019 году пара объявила об отношениях — незадолго до этого миллиардер расстался с первой женой. Предложение бизнесмен сделал во время поездки по Франции в 2023 году. Ссылка

transcript: Richmond outlet mall has welcomed brands such as Under Armour, Zwilling and Karl Lagerfeld for their first stores in the region Ten years after its launch on July 9, 2015, the McArthurGlen Outlet Vancouver Airport is bustling with shoppers, and its executives say they plan to expand the region's only outlet centre. It is a testament that retail success can come when developers target a clear niche and there is unmet demand in the market. “We're working through permitting and some leasing right now, and we'll have an opening date announcement of Phase 3 in the next couple of months,” said Robert Thurlow, general manager of what is largely a mall with tenants that sell off-price merchandise. His expected 63,000-square-foot expansion would enlarge the Richmond mall to approximately 387,000 square feet of leasable space. An expansion has been in the works for years. The mall was a success from day one. Mall executives back then counted about 160,000 shoppers in the mall's first four days, and traffic jams on roads leading to the complex disrupted vehicle flow for those heading to the nearby Vancouver International Airport. Months later it won an award for being the world's best outlet centre. The mall initially had about 240,000 square feet of leasable space, of which 156,000 square feet was leased on opening day. Within three years, the mall had filled about 96 per cent of that space with tenants, Thurlow told BIV. An 84,000-square-foot Phase 2 expansion opened toward the southeast in 2019, and Thurlow said Phase 3 is set to add another 63,000 square feet to the northeast of the original mall footprint. Fueling the expansion is retail success. Thurlow pinned the mall retailers' average annual sales per square foot at about $1,350. The mall does not take part in the International Council of Shopping Centers' (ICSC) annual ranking of Canadian shopping centres by that metric. If it had done so, it would have last year ranked No. 5 in Canada, and No. 3 in B.C., behind CF Pacific Centre's $1,454 per square foot, and CF Richmond Centre's $1,359 per square foot on the ICSC rankings. “McArthurGlen is an extremely well-performing shopping centre,” Retail Insider owner and consultant Craig Patterson told BIV. “It's got a value proposition to it. It's a mall that has stores that are known to have lower prices, and it has got a compelling mix of brands. People will line up for certain brands that are on sale, and McArthurGlen has a good number of those brands.” The mall's largest retail tenant is Ralph Lauren, which leases about 20,000 square feet, according to Thurlow. That location is Ralph Lauren's first outlet location in Metro Vancouver, he said. The clothing chain has had other full-price stores in the region but never a store that carried off-price merchandise such as out-of-season clothing or products specifically made for an outlet store, according to Thurlow. Brands that opened their first-ever store in the region – full price or outlet – at the McArthurGlen Outlet Vancouver Airport mall include Under Armour, Zwilling and Karl Lagerfeld, Thurlow said. The first Marc Jacobs outlet store in Western Canada opened at the mall earlier this year, he added. His mall caters to a wide range of tastes and price ranges, with Versace being a luxury store that has its only store in Metro Vancouver at the mall. To mark the 10th anniversary, the mall has encouraged tenants to offer special discounts. Mall management has also arranged for live music, special events and contests with prizes, such as a round-trip Helijet excursion to Victoria to stay two nights at the Fairmont Empress hotel. [email protected] twitter.com/GlenKorstrom Bluesky.com/glenkorstrom.bsky.social
